title: Longing for God
shortSummary: Psalm 42 expresses the deep spiritual thirst and longing of the psalmist for God's presence amid trials and despair. It vividly portrays the soul's struggle with discouragement while encouraging hope and trust in God's salvation and faithfulness.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy period, attributed to the sons of Korah

keyCharacters.name: The Psalmist
keyCharacters.description: The speaker who expresses deep spiritual thirst and emotional turmoil while longing for God's presence and deliverance.

keyCharacters.name: Sons of Korah
keyCharacters.description: Levitical singers and temple servants traditionally credited with composing this psalm, emphasizing worship and spiritual reflection.

definitions.definition: A term meaning 'instruction' or 'contemplation,' indicating this psalm is intended to teach or provide insight.
An old English term for a mature male deer, symbolizing intense longing or desire.
The face or presence of God, often representing His favor and approval.
A poetic expression describing overwhelming distress or the profound depths of trouble calling out to one another.

outline.heading: The Soulâ€™s Thirst for God
outline.description: The psalmist compares his soul's longing for God to a deer panting for water, expressing an intense desire to be in God's presence.

outline.heading: The Reality of Suffering and Mockery
outline.description: He recounts tears and reproach from enemies questioning God's presence, while remembering joyful worship with the community.

outline.heading: Self-Exhortation to Hope
outline.description: The psalmist encourages his discouraged soul to hope in God, recalling God's faithfulness despite feeling cast down.

outline.heading: The Overwhelming Distress
outline.description: He describes waves of trouble overwhelming him and voices his feelings of abandonment and oppression by enemies.

outline.heading: Renewed Confidence in God
outline.description: The psalmist repeats his call to hope and praise God, affirming God as the source of his joy and strength.

application: In times of spiritual dryness or discouragement, earnestly seek God with the same intensity as a deer thirsts for water.
Remember past experiences of God's faithfulness and worship to strengthen hope during trials.
Encourage your soul to hope in God and praise Him even when feelings of abandonment arise.
Use prayer and worship as means to maintain connection with God amid life's overwhelming difficulties.

keyVerses.text: As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul after thee, O God.
keyVerses.significance: This verse powerfully illustrates the psalmist's deep spiritual longing for God, setting the tone for the entire psalm.

keyVerses.text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted in me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him for the help of his countenance.
keyVerses.significance: This verse models self-exhortation to hope and trust in God despite inner turmoil.

keyVerses.text: Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted within me? hope thou in God: for I shall yet praise him, who is the health of my countenance, and my God.
keyVerses.significance: The closing verse reaffirms the psalmist's confidence in God's sustaining power and the importance of praise.
